attributes.additional_details: The government has a duty to protect its citizens but they are failing women when it comes to safety on our streets. In a recent survey from ‘UN Women UK’, 97% of women aged 18-24 had experienced sexual harassment. The fact that the government has allowed this to happen is disgusting. Public sexual harassment is degrading, dehumanising and objectifying. It is a clear form of sexism but it has become normalised in society. In other countries it’s a crime.  Why is it acceptable in the UK?
attributes.background: Girls have to learn the same lessons that women had to learn decades ago - walk in a well-lit area, carry keys between your fingers, don’t get in a taxi alone.  Too long has this been going on.  Too long has the government done nothing.  We will no longer tolerate feeling unsafe on our streets.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578940
